case_circumstances: 05/20/90, the crew of the MV Pocahontas Cargo Ship at Norfolk International Terminal discovered two bodies in the refrigerated cargo hold.  The men had started a fire in the hold in attempt to keep warm but died of carbon monoxide poisoning. The ship's last port of call was Columbia South America.
fingerprints: Fingerprint information is currently not available
case_clothing_on_body:
Black polo style shirt.
Blue jeans with brown belt.
Red underpants.
Print shorts.
White and brown sock on right foot , white sock on left foot.
Orange knit gloves.
case_other_items_with_body: Personal effects suggested that he and his traveling companion may have boarded the ship in Medellin, Colombia.
dental: Dental information / charting is currently not available
documents: There are currently no documents available for this case.
